Name: Ami Nguyen
Summary: Ami Nguyen is a public defender who previously worked as an eviction-prevention lawyer in Los Angeles. She's active in SEIU 925.
Committee: Gender Equity, Safe Communities, New Americans and Education

Name: Egan Orion
Summary: Egan Orion is the executive director of the Capitol Hill Chamber of Commerce. He also manages PrideFest Seattle Center and PrideFest Capitol Hill.
Occupation: Capitol Hill Chamber of Commerce executive director
Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: Without a doubt the homelessness crisis and all its parts — the shelter crisis, mental-health and substance-abuse crisis and the affordability crisis — is the most pressing issue in the daily lives of citizens, both sheltered and unsheltered.

Name: Kshama Sawant
Summary: Kshama Sawant is the District 3 incumbent and an activist with the Socialist Alternative Party. First elected in 2013, Sawant has focused on economic and social-justice issues.
Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: We need to make Seattle a city that is affordable for all.

Name: Logan Bowers
Summary: Logan Bowers and his wife own a cannabis store in Fremont. He used to work at Amazon and says Seattle needs denser housing.
Problem: We have more people than we have homes and it’s leading to skyrocketing costs, displacement and increased homelessness.

Name: Pat Murakami
Summary: Pat Murakami is the longtime president of the Southeast Seattle Crime Prevention Council. She ran for a City Council seat in 2017 and was defeated in the general election.
Problem: Out-of-state/country developers purchasing large parcels/developments without oversight by city leadership, resulting in unaffordable residential and commercial rental rates and mistreatment of tenants

Name: Zachary DeWolf
Summary: Zachary DeWolf is serving his first term on the Seattle School Board. He works as a program manager for All Home, King County’s coordinating agency on homelessness.
